data.event: Ten persons, most of them affiliated with former parliamentary speaker Nino Burjanadze’s party, have been arrested on charges of illegal purchase of firearms, the Georgian Interior Ministry said on March 23.

event.title: Earlier this month the Georgian tabloid Alia reported

data.event: Earlier this month the Georgian tabloid Alia reported that Bitsadze had a plan to set up armed groups.

event.title: covered the allegations extensively in its primetime news program on March 10

data.event: In an unusual move, the Rustavi 2 TV, picked up the newspaper article and covered the allegations extensively in its primetime news program on March 10.
Meanwhile, it also emerged on March 23, that an activist from the Movement for Salvation of Georgia was arrested and charged with plotting a coup.

event.title: was set up late last year

data.event: The Movement for Salvation of Georgia was set up late last year and has not been an active player in the Georgian politics.

Eka Beselia from Movement for United Georgia Party – also from the same group of parties planning April rallies, said: “There is no confidence towards such evidence put forth by the Interior Ministry.”
